text: Thanks <@U38EZFVFE> ill try that

Hey folks! How are people handling multiple eyes on the code when working with the local-dev setup? Does anyone have a particularly good workflow to pair with the `watch` that keeps everything nicely versioned and from overriding another person's changes?
dana and i just tested working on a css file together to see what would happen.  would be nice to have some sort of conflict reporting
presently, last person who saves overwrites css file changes from previous person
<@U22VBL87M>, i feel like this is something on which you would have thoughts
but i bet you are out trick or treating now :candy:
Generally we would solve this by providing multiple environments so each dev would have their own environment separate from each other and separate from the live environment
can you expand upon that?  Specifically with the multiple environment.  This is how we work generally for other projects, but unclear how that works in HubSpot.
and apologies if that is a silly question...
It isn’t available now but something we are looking into
ahhhhh
i feel less like an idiot
i stared at it for 5 minutes
Not a silly question.
Today, we offer developer sandboxes that can be used as dev environments for individual developers.
We also offer “drafts” for developer assets so that changes can be staged. Both of these work with the CLI.

So <@UDFTHC6PK> my suggestion when working on a team is for each developer to use their own developer sandbox, which works pretty well for many things. As <@U6GNQ7JBU> said, we are always looking for ways we can improve and this an area that we know needs improving.
<https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-cms-developer-sandbox> is where you can sign up for a sandbox (including using your existing HubSpot user account)
<@UDFTHC6PK>, let's play more tomorrow :slightly_smiling_face:
now i need to go trick or treating

I see in a DnD template of ours that there is an option to exclude domain stylesheets... do domain level stylesheets get pulled into custom templates by default, and if so is there a way to exclude them in coded templates?

Hi all. I’ve worked with HubSpot before but figured I’d try out local dev for my latest project. But I’m a bit confused. I can’t seem to find how I can actually see what I’m coding as I’m coding? For styling and stuff. Sorry this is probably a stupid question.
More digging has revealed the endorsed solution is to in fact not develop locally but to still upload everything and preview in HubSpot.
